DataElement.preferredName: Patient Pathologic Diagnosis Confirmation Dose Escalation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient has a confirmed pathologic diagnosis that meets the criteria for participating in the dose escalation portion of a clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Pathologic Diagnosis Confirmation Dose Escalation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._Having been established or verified._A stepwise increase in the amount of a therapeutic or investigational agent given to an individual._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Pathologic Diagnosis Confirmation Dose Escalation Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Having been established or verified.:A stepwise increase in the amount of a therapeutic or investigational agent given to an individual.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A stepwise increase in the amount of a therapeutic or investigational agent given to an individual.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: For dose escalation: Does pat
ReferenceDocuments.description: For dose escalation: Does patient have any of the following pathologic diagnosis: Confirmed diagnosis of peripheral T-cell lymphoma (PTCL) or angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma (AITL) that is refractory to at least one line of therapy or  Advanced stage Cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (CTCL), specifically CTCL NOS, small/medium T-cell lymphoma (SMTCL) and mycosis fungoides (MF) stage IB, IIA, IIB, III and IV that have relapsed after at least one specific prior therapy (e.g. interferon, photopheresis, denileukin difitox, bexarotene, etc), or Follicular lymphoma grade 1, 2 or 3A that meets the following criteria: a) Relapsed or refractory to at least 2 lines of therapy AND b) Relapsed or refractory post autologous cell transplantation (HCT)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a diagnosis of either MF or SS by the World Health Organization (WHO) 2016 classification (Swerdlow et al., 2017), stage IB-IV by modified International Society for Cutaneous Lymphomas (ISCL)/ European Organization of Research and Treatment of Cancer (EORTC) classification (Olsen et al., 2011), without large cell transformation (LCT) at the time of screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a diagnosis of either MF or SS, stage IB-IV, without large cell transformation (LCT) at the time of screening?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have histologically or cytologically confirmed MF or SS, stages IIB to IVB with measurable disease and/or detectable blood involvement based on the Global Cutaneous Lymphoma Response Criteria (see Appendix B) (Olsen et al., 2011)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Dose Escalation: Does patient have histologically confirmed relapsed or refractory B cell lymphoma (NHL or HL)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled in the Dose Escalation Cohort do they meet the following criteria: Known PD-L1 status is not required prior to study enrollment. Central PD-L1 testing (on archival tumor tissue) will occur retrospectively. Any number of prior lines of therapy are allowed in the metastatic setting.  Prior immune checkpoint inhibitor allowed in any setting.  Evaluable or measurable disease per RECIST 1.1 criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: For dose escalation: Does patient have any solid tumor with either O6-Methylguanine DNA Methyltransferase (MGMT) promoter hypermethylation positivity on testing / pre-screening of archival tissue OR an extracranial solid tumor where TMZ is considered a standard of care (Neuroendocrine tumor, small cell lung cancer, melanoma, or soft tissue sarcoma)?
